0.43.text:
The story of democracy in Britain is an
inspiring one

3.09.text:
it's a story of ordinary people taking
more and more power into their own hands

8.00.text: over their country over their government and ultimately over their own lives

12.32.text:
and they did this by voting in
ever-increasing numbers

16.12.text:
we've been electing our members of
parliament since the fifteenth century

21.80.text: at at first only very few

27.12.text: then came the great Reform Act 1832 now you didn't need to be quite so rich

31.36.text: but still only eight-percent of adults had the vote

38.40.text: expanded to include all men of property, but still not the

41.79.text: poorest. At last in 1918, all men

45.47.text: over 21 were allowed to vote and finally

48.47.text: women but only it they were over 30 it wasn't until 1928

55.90.text:
a full forty years later before the
franchise was given to 18-year-olds

61.09.text:
finally everyone had the vote, and almost
everyone used that power

70.03.text:
eligible voters voted, even as recently
as 1992

76.89.text:
something went terribly wrong, people
started to turn away from politics

80.85.text: they stop voting, centuries of progress

87.02.text: less than sixty percent voted, and not got much better since then.

91.83.text: At the Electoral Reform Society we believe that's a real problem

96.60.text:
democracy is too precious to be allowed
to wither away

99.83.text:
we want to see the next great reform of
Britain's political system

103.66.text:
to ensure people are given the powers
which they deserve

107.02.text: and which are democratic history demands. That's why we're campaigning

111.95.text: for franchise, where every vote counts

116.18.text:
where it's easier to get on the Electoral
Register

119.83.text: and were 16 and 17 year olds are brought  into our democracy.

124.78.text: It's why we're looking at who runs Britain

128.26.text:
so we can put an end to the absurdity of
our unelected House of Lords

132.06.text:
clean up party funding and make sure
Parliament

135.11.text:
actually looks like country it's
supposed to represent.

138.22.text: And it's why we've got our eye on the horizon

141.35.text:
with long-term work on the future of the
political party

145.42.text:
on European democracy and on a
constitutional settlement

149.04.text: for the United Kingdom. We can't do this without you're help

152.59.text: if you cherish our democratic history

156.06.text:
and care about our future please give
what you can

159.91.text: your donation will help us make the case

163.01.text:
for the reforms our politics desperately
needs

166.17.text:
you could help bring about a truly 21st
century democracy

171.03.text: together we can build a better democracy
